front.title: Encrypted Key Transport for Secure RTP

abstract.t: Encrypted Key Transport (EKT) is an extension to Secure Real-time Transport Protocol (SRTP) that provides for the secure transport of SRTP master keys, Rollover Counters, and other information within SRTP. This facility enables SRTP to work for decentralized conferences with minimal control by allowing a common key to be used across multiple endpoints.
